intro: Agrostophyllum mearnsii, commonly known as the Mearns' agrostophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal areas and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
